name: "Pulp" for Fans Online Quiz | Movies | 15 Questions

questions.text: Does Kathy Griffin play herself in the movie?
On the marquee that advertises Butch's fight, it says "Coolidge vs Wilson". There is another fight advertised on the marquee. What is it?
questions.explanation:
Vossler vs Martinez.

	The reference is to Russell Vossler and Jerry Martinez, who are two friends of Tarantino's from when he worked in a video store.

questions.text: What is the name of the book that Vincent is reading?
questions.explanation:
Modesty Blaise.

	In that book, a killer indulges in a Biblical rant very similar to that of Samuel L. Jackson's character.

questions.text: What is the name of the man Butch talks to from the pay phone?
Why hasn't Jules eaten a hamburger for a lot of time?
options: He heard on the news they found rats in Burger King
questions.explanation:
He's dating a vegetarian.

	That's what he tells Brett.

questions.text: What is the name of the actress that played the innocent bystander shot by Marsellus Wallace?
questions.explanation:
Linda Kaye &  Kaye.

	She was also pulled out of her car by Mr. Pink in "Reservoir Dogs".

questions.text: What brand of cigarettes does Butch smoke?
questions.explanation:
Red Apple.

	The same brand is smoked by Tim Roth's character in "Four Rooms".

questions.text: Mia and Vincent won the dancing contest, thus, they returned to Mia's house with the trophy. Is this true or false?
questions.explanation:
False.

	When Butch goes through the alley, the radio says that the dancing trophy from Jack Rabbit Slim's had been stolen. So you might think that Mia and Vincent did not win, but in fact stole the trophy to make it look like they had won. But the trophy they take home is not the same as the one we see in the diner.

questions.text: Quentin Tarantino wrote only one of the three stories before he wrote "Reservoir Dogs" and "True Romance".
questions.explanation:
False.

	He wrote two of the stories, not one.

questions.text: What is the name of the TV show young Butch watches when Captain Koons gives him the watch?
Steve Buscemi has a cameo in the film. How is he credited in the end credits?
questions.explanation:
Buddy Holly.

	A popular theory about it is that this is actually Mr. Pink from "Reservoir Dogs", hiding from the cops. But I question that theory. If he wanted to hide from the cops, why didn't he move out of LA?

questions.text: What is the name of the character Jules refers to as a "Flock of Seagulls"?
What is the name of the actor who plays the gimp?
questions.explanation:
Stephen Hibbert.

	In the edited-for-television version of the film, extreme measures are taken to erase all evidence of the Gimp. All mentions of him and all his scenes are deleted. In one scene with Zed talking, where in the original film a small portion of the Gimp's shoulder is visible the bottom right corner of the screen, the television version removes it by zooming in on Zed a bit more.

questions.text: In the deleted scenes, who played Monster Joe?
